prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0031] **Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane** Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system described above. **Step 3: Create a rectangle in the 2D sketch** Create a rectangle by adding the following lines to the 2D sketch: - Line 1: Starting point [0.0, 0.0], End point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Starting point [0.75, 0.0], End point [0.75, 0.2036] - Line 3: Starting point [0.75, 0.2036], End point [0.0, 0.2036] - Line 4: Starting point [0.0, 0.2036], End point [0.0, 0.0] **Step 4: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. **Step 5: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D** Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0031] **Step 6: Extrude the 2D sketch to create the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch along its normal vector by a distance of 0.0031 units, and set the sketch scale to 0.75. Set the operation to create a new solid body. This will create the final shape of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. **Shape Description** The final shape will be a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height will be approximately twice the width, and the length of the shorter side will be about half the length of the longer side. The dimensions of the shape will be: - Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is approximately twice the width. The length of the shorter side is about half the length of the longer side. - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.0031 units **Part 2 and Beyond** The above steps provide a detailed guide for constructing a single intermediate CAD part in a CAD assembly. To build subsequent parts, follow similar steps using the appropriate parameters and operations as listed in the CAD assembly JSON. Always begin by creating a new coordinate system for each part, and follow the steps to create a 2D sketch, scale, transform, and extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model. Be sure to use the provided JSON data to define the appropriate parameters for each part, and use the extracted sketches, loops, and faces to create the intermediate CAD models. Finally, combine the intermediate models using the appropriate boolean operations to create the complete CAD assembly. Remember to provide clear headings and section breaks to organize each part's instructions, and use the `<part_num>` tags to distinguish between parts throughout the process.</description>

For the sketch on the first face, draw the outer circle with a center at (0.0625, 0.0625) and a radius of 0.0625. On the second face, draw the inner circle with a center at (0.5625, 0.0625) and a radius of 0.0625. Extrude both sketches in the negative Z direction by 0.125 units, effectively creating a cut-out that has a rectangular shape and is slightly offset to the right of the larger cylinder. **Part 3: Cylindrical object with a tapered end** Create a new coordinate system with the provided rotation and translation values. On the first face, draw the outer circle with a center at (0.0306, 0.0306) and a radius of 0.0306. On the second face, draw the inner circle with a center at (0.5306, 0.0306) and a radius of 0.0306. Extrude both sketches in the negative Z direction by 0.3125 units, effectively creating a cut-out with a tapered end. **Part 4: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom and a slightly curved side** Create a new coordinate system with the given rotation and translation values. For the first face, draw the rectangle using the following four lines: - Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.75, 0) - Line 2: (0.75, 0) to (0.75, 0.125) - Line 3: (0.75, 0.125) to (0, 0.125) - Line 4: (0, 0.125) to (0, 0) For the second face, draw the rectangle using the following four lines: - Line 1: (0, 0.1875) to (0.75, 0.1875) - Line 2: (0.75, 0.1875) to (0.75, 0.3125) - Line 3: (0.75, 0.3125) to (0, 0.3125) - Line 4: (0, 0.3125) to (0, 0.1875) Extrude the sketches in the negative Z direction by 0.025 units to create the slightly curved side and pointed end. **Part 5: A cylindrical object with a tapered end resembling a metallic tube or pipe** Create a new coordinate system with the provided rotation and translation values. For the sketch, draw the outer circle with a center at (0.0375, 0.0375) and a radius of 0.0375. Extrude the sketch in the negative Z direction by 0.075 units to create a new 3D body with a tapered end.</description>
